body.p:
Richmond Ky
April 5th 1862
Gov B_ MaGoffin

Sir: Last fall we Sent you a copy of an order of Court Stating that the Judge of the Madison Circuit Court refused to preside on the trial of Francis Searcy under an indictment for Murder -- Whereupon you designated Judge Burns to preside on the trial of the case. Burns has gone out of office & the case has not been tryed. The residence of the Hon. Melton Durham is nearer to this place than that of any other Judge & no party will object to Judge Durham presiding on the trial -- Col Searcy desires a trial as early as possible & we hope you will immediately designate Judge Durham to preside

Respectfully
Yours
Squire Turner
Jas B McCreary

Madison Cir Court
M. J. Durham
Appd to hold Special term in the Case of F. M. Searcey
Appd Apr 9. 1862
